alert.note: Alert for Conecuh; Monroe (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 22 at 8:41PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Alabama, including the following counties, Conecuh and Monroe. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 840 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated slow moving thunderstorms producing very heavy rain over the advisory area. 1.5 to 2.5 inches of rain have likely fallen over some locations during the past hour. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fairnelson, Fowler, Bowles, Skinnerton, Cooks Crossroads, Bookers Mill, Lyeffion, China, Ramah, Pine Orchard, Commerce, Deans, Loree, Burnt Corn, Mixonville, Nichburg, Old Texas, Wilcox and Bermuda.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
